abstract: HSBC announced that it would cut 500 jobs in Asia. And Citigroup’s roughly 50,000 employees were faced with the reality that some of job cuts announced Monday could hit them.
snippet: HSBC announced that it would cut 500 jobs in Asia. And Citigroup’s roughly 50,000 employees were faced with the reality that some of job cuts announced Monday could hit them.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  Bankers in Asia had been largely immune to the fallout from the global financial crisis. But as the economic malaise consumes country after country, those jobs are no longer viewed as safe.

headline.main: Asian Banks, Once Thought Safe From Crisis, Are Now Hurting
headline.print_headline: Asian Banks, Once Thought Safe From Crisis, Are Now Hurting

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
